comments: Toughest class I have had so far, but very informational. He expects reasonable goals from his students since most of us are going into the medical field. You have to put HOURS aside for his class. I would spend a good week before his test, studying ALL of his power points because questions can come from anywhere! Very helpful teacher as well.

comments: Nice guy and all, but extremely hard class. All A&P are hard but he made it the hardest. Powerpoints are all he uses to teach with. 40+ slides on wach one usually. He tested us on 10 different powerpoints one time. The test was only 50 multiple choice Q\'s so you dont know what to study. Some students did get As though.. idk how. 3 tests and a final

comments: Decent guy he\'s got jokes, but teaching wise his test are hard, no homework, barely any quizzes, and No extra credit. Teaches from power points, but teaches buku topics at once and teaches at fast pace. Classes usually lasted 30-45 min. He does help you on questions on the test if you have any though.

comments: Chris is awesome. He\'s wrestled crocodiles on TV. He has field experience which is super cool. That being said, he expects a lot of you, but he is willing to help. Go to his office, he will tell you exactly what to focus on. If you want him to really like you mention "Saved by the Bell". He loves that show.

He gives bonus points for the most random things. You definitely have to go to class though because there is a quiz every week.

comments: I love Mr. Murray! He is so hilarious and makes the boring subject of biology actually fun. He gives chances for extra credit and also he has quizzes every class that are simple to boost your grade. If you go to class, participate in labs, do your lab reports, and study for the midterm and final you will get an easy A!

If you HAVE to take him, make sure you take a light course load so you can focus on his class. He rushes through slides and doesn\'t emphasize what is important for the test.

comments: I took Mr. Murray for Bio lab 152. He was awesome! He is funny and makes class interesting. There are pop quizzes before each class(only 5 questions), read ahead in your biology lab manual if you want the A. He is super intelligent. He told us he studdied crocodiles in Costa Rica! Who wouldn\'t want him?! I\'m taking again for ZOO 250....
